tweezer.rnap package¶

Submodules¶

tweezer.rnap.models module¶

Collection of models put forward in the literature to explain the motion RNA Polymerases.

the aim is to fit these models to data obtained by optical tweezer experiments.

References:

[Ishibashi:2014cd1987:nelson]

class tweezer.rnap.models.BacktrackingModel[source]¶

Bases: tweezer.rnap.models.TranscriptionModel

This model assumes that backtracking is the only mechanism for pausing.

It models backtracking as a diffusive process with an absorbing barrier.

class tweezer.rnap.models.MultipleExponentialModel[source]¶

Bases: tweezer.rnap.models.TranscriptionModel

This model corresponds to distributions generated by conventional biochemical kinetic models, i.e. discrete states connected by reaction rates.

class tweezer.rnap.models.PowerLawModel[source]¶

Bases: tweezer.rnap.models.TranscriptionModel

This model is a generic description of the observed pause distributions, but does not provide a clear insight of how these distributions come about.

class tweezer.rnap.models.TranscriptionModel[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

General container class for rnap models

tweezer.rnap.simulations module¶

Collection of simulations of the rnap process by RNA Polymerases.

References:

[Ishibashi:2014cd1987:nelson]

class tweezer.rnap.simulations.BacktrackingSimulation[source]¶

Bases: tweezer.rnap.simulations.TranscriptionSimulation

class tweezer.rnap.simulations.OnlyForwardSimulation[source]¶

Bases: tweezer.rnap.simulations.TranscriptionSimulation

This simulation assumes that no backtracking occurs and that the RNAP just waits.

class tweezer.rnap.simulations.TranscriptionSimulation[source]¶

Bases: builtins.object

General container class for simulations of rnap traces.

Module contents¶

Module for analysis and simulation of the rnap process as studied in optical tweezers.

The main aim is to understand the workings of RNA Polymerases by modeling and comparison with single-molecule experiments
